results.title: Thursday's children
results.creator_credit: Morse Films, World Wide, Guy Brenton and Lindsay Anderson
results.brief_description: Academy award winning documentary by Lindsay Anderson and Guy Brenton about the problem of educating children who are born deaf, and stresses the mutual trust and spontaneity of expression that deafness gives these children in compensation. Narrated by Sir Richard Burton, the Royal School for the Deaf in Margate is used to demonstrate how children must first be introduced to the idea of words, understand when words are spoken and to reproduce sounds they cannot hear. A masterpiece of sensitivity and dignity.

results.title: Thunderstruck
results.creator_credit: Jodi Matterson, ICON, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Showtime, Sony Music Australia and Darren Ashton
results.brief_description: Four mates go on the road with a mission - to scatter the ashes of a friend on the grave of Bon Scott, original frontman for rock band AC/DC. Struggling in their own way with adulthood, the lads get the band back together to live out their promise made to each other 12 years ago - that should any of them die they would be buried out West next to Scott. Living out this pact is harder than they think with a lot of obstacles getting in the way on their life-changing journey. Written and directed by Darren Ashton (co-writer Shaun Angus Hall). Cast includes Damon Gameau, Stephen Curry, Ryan Johnson, Callan Mulvey, Sam Worthington.

results.title: Thundering wheels
results.creator_credit: Hideo Kamo, Nagai Eigasha and Yoshi Tanaka
results.brief_description: A survey of the Japanese National Railways. From small beginnings in 1872, the system has expanded the length and breadth of Japan’s four islands, covering a distance in excess of 13,000 miles.

results.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot
results.creator_credit: Robert Daley, United Artists Corporation, Malpaso Company and Michael Cimino
results.brief_description: A golden field of wheat waves serenely under a blue Montana sky. A congregation of just-plain-folks in a quaint wooden church listens intently to the preacher. Then, just when you begin to wonder if you’ve somehow wandered into a Norman Rockwell painting, a man steps through the door and begins spraying the pulpit with automatic pistol fire. Clint Eastwood and Jeff Bridges star in this offbeat saga of a colourful group of bank robbers determined to “re-pull” a master heist of the fortress-like Montana Armoured Depository. In his directorial debut, Cimino injects the comedy-drama with an inventiveness and unpredictability rarely seen in the caper genre. Bridges received a Best Supporting Actor Academy Award nomination for his performance as Lightfoot.

results.title: Thunderbirds. Volume 3
results.creator_credit: Gerry Anderson, APF Television Production, Associated Television, David Lane, Alan Pattillo and David Elliot
results.brief_description: 1960s British animated television series set in 2065, about a family and their associates combating various dangers with a mix of technology and intelligence. Using marionettes, “Thunderbirds” made impressive use of supermarionation - a puppetry technique that used fine wires and electronics to move the puppets’ lips. John, Virgil, Scott, Gordon and Alan Tracy are brothers who combat danger using their numerous spacecrafts, working for International Rescue, helmed by their father Jeff. Brains, Lady Penelope, Parker, Kyrano and Tin-Tin ably assist the family on their missions. Four episodes from the show are: “The Brink of disaster”: Jeff, Brains and Tin-Tin must think quickly to save themselves and the others onboard, when caught on a perilous monorail journey. “Perils of Penelope”: When Lady Penelope is kidnapped she is set to die unless an eminent scientist reveals his secrets to the enemy. Virgil and Gordon battle to free her. “Terror in New York City”: When the Empire State Building is moved to a new site, several men are trapped in a cave-in. Brains combats the odds and a massive tidal wave. “End of the road”: When a family friend is stranded on a cliff, the Tracy boys band together to rescue him.

results.title: Thunderbirds. Volume 2
results.creator_credit: Gerry Anderson, APF Television Production, Associated Television, Desmond Saunders, David Lane and David Elliot
results.brief_description: 1960s British animated television series set in 2065, about a family and their associates combating various dangers with a mix of technology and intelligence. Using marionettes, “Thunderbirds” made impressive use of supermarionation - a puppetry technique that used fine wires and electronics to move the puppets’ lips. John, Virgil, Scott, Gordon and Alan Tracy are brothers who combat danger using their numerous spacecrafts, working for International Rescue, helmed by their father Jeff. Brains, Lady Penelope, Parker, Kyrano and Tin-Tin ably assist the family on their missions. Four episodes from the show are: “The Uninvited”: Scott is forced down in the desert by a mysterious force. When he is captured along with two archaeologists, they must fight to escape. “The Mighty atom”: The Hood is back - and after stealing ‘The Mighty Atom’, tries to programme the robot rat to take photographs of the Thunderbirds, in order to undermine their operation. “The Vault of death”: A helpless man trapped inside the Bank of England vault is set to die unless the team from International Rescue, aided by Parker and Lady Penelope, can devise a nifty way to save him. “Operation crash dive”: When two airliners crash into the Atlantic, International Rescue must investigate the mysterious circumstances. Wonderfully inventive television, suitable for children.

results.title: Thunderbirds. Volume 1
results.creator_credit: Gerry Anderson, APF Television Production, Associated Television, Alan Pattillo, Desmond Saunders, David Elliot and David Lane
results.brief_description: 1960s British animated television series set in 2065, about a family and their associates combating various dangers with a mix of technology and intelligence. Using marionettes, “Thunderbirds” made impressive use of supermarionation - a puppetry technique that used fine wires and electronics to move the puppets’ lips. John, Virgil, Scott, Gordon and Alan Tracy are brothers who combat danger using their numerous spacecrafts, working for International Rescue, helmed by their father Jeff. Brains, Lady Penelope, Parker, Kyrano and Tin-Tin ably assist the family on their missions. Four episodes from the show are: “Trapped in the sky”: Arch-enemy The Hood places an explosive device aboard an aircraft in order to photograph Thunderbirds craft. “Pit of peril”: A revolutionary mobile unit used by the Army goes haywire and the ingenious Brains battles to right the vehicle and save the lives of those on board. “City of fire”: When a fire breaks out in a space age shopping mall, Scott and Virgil try to save one trapped family from certain death. “Sun probe”: A research ship loses its way and is headed for a collision course with the sun. Alan and Scott are called upon to right its trajectory, in a daring rescue mission. Wonderfully inventive television, suitable for children.

results.title: Thunderbirds in China
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, ONF | NFB and Les Rose
results.brief_description: Young Vancouver hockey players, the University of British Columbia Thunderbirds, undertake to show their skills to the new teams of China. It is a journey that takes them far into that vast country and to an understanding of East and West. Hockey in China still has far to go, but this film leaves no doubt that the Chinese players and fans are alive to the challenge. A film of fresh insight and discovery for all audiences, whether hockey-minded or not.

results.title: Thunderbirds are go
results.creator_credit: Sylvia Anderson, Associated Television (Overseas) Ltd and David Lane
results.brief_description: The Tracy team launch a highly dangerous rescue mission in space in this first feature-length Thunderbirds classic. SZero X, a 21st century spacecraft, is suddenly blasted by a strange explosion as it leaves the Earth’s atmosphere bound for Mars. Is it sabotage? Can the Thunderbirds discover the perpetrators and save the next launch? This adventure film is gadget loaded and features visual effects by Derek Meddings as well as sound effects by some of London’s famous rock stars, including Cliff Richards.

results.title: Thunderball (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Kevin McClory, Danjaq, Eon Productions, Terence Young and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Thunderball is the fourth Bond film with Sean Connery playing British secret service agent 007, pitting his stylish form against the espionage organisation SPECTRE (Special Executive for Counter-Terrorism, Revenge and Extortion), with Emilio Largo at the helm. SPECTRE plans to hijack a nuclear bomb, plant it under the sea, and then hold the world for ransom. Set in the Bahamas, “Thunderball” provides plenty of lush scenery with spectacular beaches, sprawling mansions and beautiful women in bathing costumes. The under water setting allows for some spectacular ideas and elaborate set pieces. Typical Bond touches include a myriad of one liners and nubile lady friends including a masseuse; Largo’s mistress; a British spy; and an enemy agent. Highlights include a Mardi Gras sequence with James evading capture due to a frenetic, chaotic moment. Other fine moments are the irascible Q displaying Bond’s latest gadgets whilst whingeing about being dragged to the Bahamas in order to do so. Re-made in 1993 as “Never say never again.”
